abstract: Workers at the men’s clothing maker Hartmarx are hoping to save their jobs by pressuring the bankrupt company’s main creditor to approve a sale that would keep the company alive.
snippet: Workers at the men’s clothing maker Hartmarx are hoping to save their jobs by pressuring the bankrupt company’s main creditor to approve a sale that would keep the company alive.
lead_paragraph: DES PLAINES, Ill.  Hartmarx, known for its Hart Schaffner & Marx and Hickey Freeman suits, and for making President Obama’s inauguration tuxedo and topcoat, has long been America’s leading clothier for men. Now its workers want to make the company, which is in bankruptcy, a leader in a different way.

headline.main: Workers Pressure Bank to Keep Clothier’s U.S. Plants Open
headline.print_headline: Workers Pressure Bank to Keep Clothier’s U.S. Plants Open
